intro: Winklera, commonly known as the wax plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plants typically have small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. Winklera species are native to Africa, particularly South Africa, and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. They are adapted to hot, dry climates and are sometimes cultivated as ornamental plants.
